intro: Perymenium hondurense, commonly known as the Honduran perymenium, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Honduras. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
